about: What it is:¬†A super smooth liquid cream blush with high impact pigments that blends seamlessly and dries down to a natural flush of color on any skin tone..Finish:¬†Natural.Formulation:¬†Liquid..Ingredient Callouts: Free of parabens, formaldehydes, formaldehyde-releasing agents, phthalates, mineral oil, retinyl palmitate, oxybenzone, coal tar, hydroquinone, sulfates SLS & SLES, triclocarban, triclosan, and contains less than one percent synthetic fragrance. This new and improved formula with enhanced blendability dries down beautifully for a natural skin finish. It‚Äôs lightweight, longwearing, and clean...
how_to_use: Suggested Usage:.-Apply with a brush or your fingertips to cheeks, bridge of the nose, temples, or wherever else you desire..-This formula will dry down and stay put. For optimal application, apply and blend quickly to one area at a time..-Add more to amplify color and definition.

reviews.review_title: Amazing product with a REAL learning curve.
reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I love this product, and I'm going to buy it again. So why three stars? It is the trickiest cheek tint I've ever used. But I was so close to giving it 5 stars.  Prior to this, I'd only used drug store cheek tints. I loved them, but the bottles never lasted long, and getting even coverage could be kinda hard. When I got the bottle, I was a bit stunned by how small it was -- I mean, for $22 it's TINY. But then you use it, and you're like... OH. I thought I'd squeezed a small amount on my hand. I stuck a finger in, put it on my cheek, went to rub it in... and the amount on my finger could have made my whole entire face pink.  Figuring out the right amount of this to use and how to blend it is a real challenge. But ultimately, I decided that you get so MUCH pigment (and it's so lovely, and goes on sheer, and looks great on my skin) that it was worth it.  The thing is, those cheaper, more-watery tints? Are WAY easier to use. So here's some tips to get around the learning curve:  1) Squeeze it *right side up.* I cannot emphasize this enough. If you hold the bottle upside-down, too much will come out.  2) You want the smallest amount possible to come out. Like, you want to measure it in millimeters, not drops. 2 millimeters was more than enough to cover both cheeks, and even then I still had to dab off a bit.  3) How blendable it is depends on what you're putting it on. Great on bare skin, a bit sticky on a CC cream, great on tinted moisturizer and more hydrating sunscreens or regular moisturizer. Iffy on more dry sunscreens.  4) for best results, apply with fingers.  5) for sheer coverage or easier application, mix with a moisturizer.  all of that being said, it spreads so evenly precisely because it's so pigmented. It takes work. But it is sheer, and gorgeous, and natural-looking, and I'm obsessed.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Cheekslime in Love Flush is one of the most amazing and beautiful liquid blushes I have ever tried. The Love Flush shade is a beautiful neutral pink bunny tongue shade, perfect for every day wear. This liquid blush goes on matte, but you can also build it from a subtle flush to a full impact pink. Though it is matte, this formula has a creamy rich texture perfect for the cheeks, lips, and nose. I actually really loved it on the lips as well, the formula has all day staying power.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, blonde hair, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: As someone who typically doesn't like liquid blush, I have to say that I will make an exception for this blush (with a few added notes). However, it's easy to explain why I like this formula: it's not entirely liquid, per se, and instead it feels more like a liquid/gel hybrid.  I chose the shade love flush, which is a gorgeous warm, peachy/rose shade. On my first time applying, I confess I went a bit overboard for my fair skin. A little goes a VERY long way with this product (and at 0.5 fl oz, I expect to have this for years to come lol). In spite of overdoing it, I could already tell that it blends out beautifully, but it looked a little...well, intense lol!  On my second wear, I was more cautious to squeeze out a small amount onto the back of my hand and carefully apply, building as needed. This gave such a pretty, natural look and wore all day.  I confess I am tempted to rate this 4 stars for my skin tone, as it does take a bit more work BUT...i feel that's unfair to the product. So many blushes exclude deeper skin tones, and yet with the richness of pigment Freck offers here, I think this is a blush that will be easy and effective for medium-deep skin tones (while fellow fair skin tones might have a learning curve). And dear reader, that inclusivity is stellar to see!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, Oily skin
